name: Japanese Goddess of the Sun Quiz | Religion | 5 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the Japanese sun goddess?
questions.explanation:
Amaterasu.

	The full name of the sun goddess is Amaterasu Omikami, one of the rare instances in world myth where the sun is personified as female.

questions.text: She was born of the tears of her father. What was her father's name?
questions.explanation:
Izanagi.

	Izanagi weeped when he saw the decayed body of his mate Izanami, who had been killed.  He then created Amaterasu, his beloved daughter, from his tears.

questions.text: What was the name of the 'High Celestial Plain' that she was given by her father to rule?
questions.explanation:
Takamagahara.

	The 'High Celestial Plain' could otherwise be referred to as the sky, where the sun resides!

questions.text: Who was her great (x6) grandson and first emperor of Japan?
questions.explanation:
Jimmu.

	Jimmu is considered to be the first emperor of Japan, and was said to have ruled around 600 B.C.  He, and the rest of the emperors (called "tenno", in Japanese), are said to be descended from Amaterasu.

questions.text: Which of the following items of the imperial regalia does not symbolize her?
questions.explanation:
Crown.

	Up to the present day these items are symbols of the emperor and of the Shinto religious system which centers on Amaterasu.  I hope you have learned a bit from this quiz, thank you for playing.
